item.title: Louisville police: Releasing records in Breonna Taylor case hurts impartial investigation
item.description: The Courier Journal sued Louisville police in May, demanding the release of the investigative file into the fatal police shooting of Breonna Taylor.
item.author: Louisville Courier Journal
item.dc:creator: Tessa Duvall, Louisville Courier Journal
item.content:encoded: The Courier Journal sued Louisville police in May, demanding the release of the investigative file into the fatal police shooting of Breonna Taylor.

item.title: Tropical Storm Gonzalo forms in the Atlantic, expected to become a hurricane on Thursday
item.description: Tropical Storm Gonzalo is the earliest "G" storm in any Atlantic hurricane season on record. It is expected to become a hurricane by Thursday.
item.author: USA TODAY
item.dc:creator: Doyle Rice, USA TODAY
item.content:encoded: Tropical Storm Gonzalo is the earliest "G" storm in any Atlantic hurricane season on record. It is expected to become a hurricane by Thursday.

item.title: The US coin shortage
item.description: In the midst of a nationwide coin shortage, some retailers are asking for customers to use exact change, if possible, or even better, use a credit or debit card for payment.
item.author: Wochit
item.dc:creator: Wochit
item.content:encoded: In the midst of a nationwide coin shortage, some retailers are asking for customers to use exact change, if possible, or even better, use a credit or debit card for payment.

item.title: Another Fort Hood soldier has been found dead. It's at least the fourth death this year.
item.description: Pvt. Mejhor Morta, 26, is one of at least four Fort Hood soldiers whose bodies were found near the post this year.
item.author: Austin American-Statesman
item.dc:creator: Heather Osbourne, Austin American-Stateman
item.content:encoded: Pvt. Mejhor Morta, 26, is one of at least four Fort Hood soldiers whose bodies were found near the post this year.

item.title: Thanks to coronavirus, Americans looking at a stay-at-home fall season, survey suggests
item.description: Summer is not even half over, but most Americans expect fall to be more of the same: work from home, school from home and few getaways far from home.
item.author: USA TODAY
item.dc:creator: Mike Snider, USA TODAY
item.content:encoded: Summer is not even half over, but most Americans expect fall to be more of the same: work from home, school from home and few getaways far from home.

item.title: Judge declines to dismiss charges against Register reporter, but orders state to produce bodycam footage
item.description: The judge wrote that he expects prosecutors to have recordings and reports from those who arrested Sahouri ready to share by the next court date.
item.author: Des Moines Register
item.dc:creator: Tyler J. Davis, Des Moines Register
item.content:encoded: The judge wrote that he expects prosecutors to have recordings and reports from those who arrested Sahouri ready to share by the next court date.

item.title: C.T. Vivian was a giant figure in the civil rights movement: 5 things you may not have known about him
item.description: C.T. Vivian led his first sit-in demonstration in 1947 in Peoria, Illinois. After that, his civil rights career stretched for more than six decades.
item.author: USA TODAY
item.dc:creator: Lorenzo Reyes, USA TODAY
item.content:encoded: C.T. Vivian led his first sit-in demonstration in 1947 in Peoria, Illinois. After that, his civil rights career stretched for more than six decades.

item.title: 'This is not a dictatorship!': Portland protesters push back harder against Trump, federal agents
item.description: President Donald Trump sent federal agents to Portland to crack down on protesters. His move appears to have backfired and energized activists.
item.author: USA TODAY
item.dc:creator: Trevor Hughes and Lindsay Schnell, USA TODAY
item.content:encoded: President Donald Trump sent federal agents to Portland to crack down on protesters. His move appears to have backfired and energized activists.

item.title: A powerful 7.8 earthquake struck the Alaska Peninsula and triggered a tsunami warning
item.description: A powerful 7.8 earthquake prompted a tsunami warning in Alaska and caused residents to flee to higher ground.
item.author: Associated Press
item.dc:creator: USA TODAY, Associated Press
item.content:encoded: A powerful 7.8 earthquake prompted a tsunami warning in Alaska and caused residents to flee to higher ground.

item.title: Florida community mourns three friends killed in 'massacre' on fishing trip
item.description: Loved ones have constructed a roadside memorial for three friends killed on a fishing trip in Florida over the weekend.
item.author: The Ledger
item.dc:creator: Suzie Schottelkotte, The (Lakeland, Fla.) Ledger
item.content:encoded: Loved ones have constructed a roadside memorial for three friends killed on a fishing trip in Florida over the weekend.

item.title: Anti-feminism warning signs we should all know

item.content:encoded: UCLA gender studies professor Dr. Juliet Williams explains the rhetoric and dangers with misogyny.

item.title: Police: 15 injured after drive-by shoot-out at Chicago funeral, 1 'person of interest' in custody
item.description: Police in Chicago are investigating after a shooting at a funeral left 15 people injured. There was a squad car assigned to the funeral ahead of time.
item.author: USA TODAY
item.dc:creator: Jordan Culver, USA TODAY
item.content:encoded: Police in Chicago are investigating after a shooting at a funeral left 15 people injured. There was a squad car assigned to the funeral ahead of time.

item.title: Powerful 7.8 earthquake rocks Alaska isles; tsunami warning canceled
item.description: An earthquake of the Alaska Peninsula triggered a tsunami warning for much of the coastal region of the state that was later called off.
item.author: USA TODAY
item.dc:creator: Ryan W. Miller, USA TODAY
item.content:encoded: An earthquake of the Alaska Peninsula triggered a tsunami warning for much of the coastal region of the state that was later called off.

item.title: Crowe wants to address mental illness in 'Unhinged'
item.description: Russell Crowe was reluctant to take on the role of a deranged driver with a bad case of road rage in "Unhinged," especially if it was going to take the subject lightly. (July 22)
item.author: AP Domestic
item.dc:creator: AP
item.content:encoded: Russell Crowe was reluctant to take on the role of a deranged driver with a bad case of road rage in "Unhinged," especially if it was going to take the subject lightly. (July 22)

item.content:encoded: At 56 and 5'3", Sports Illustrated model Kathy Jacobs wants to "raise awareness" about definitions of beauty. (July 22)

item.title: AP Top Stories July 22 A
item.description: Here's the latest for Wednesday July 22nd: More negotiations over COVID-19 relief deal; Authorities and protesters clash in Portland; 14 shot outside Chicago funeral home; Colorado Gov. tells bars and restaurants to stop serving drinks earlier.

item.dc:creator: AP
item.content:encoded: Here's the latest for Wednesday July 22nd: More negotiations over COVID-19 relief deal; Authorities and protesters clash in Portland; 14 shot outside Chicago funeral home; Colorado Gov. tells bars and restaurants to stop serving drinks earlier.

item.title: Daycares welcome mask-wearing toddlers as parents struggle to 'make best decision' in COVID-19 world

item.title: US orders China to close Houston consulate
item.description: The U.S. ordered China to close its Houston consulate in what a Chinese official called an outrageous and unjustified move. Media reports in Houston said that authorities had responded to reports of a fire at the Chinese Consulate late Tuesday. (July 22)
item.author: AP Domestic
item.dc:creator: AP
item.content:encoded: The U.S. ordered China to close its Houston consulate in what a Chinese official called an outrageous and unjustified move. Media reports in Houston said that authorities had responded to reports of a fire at the Chinese Consulate late Tuesday. (July 22)

item.title: Officers disperse Portland protesters
item.description: Authorities in Portland, Oregon dispersed a large crowd of demonstrators near the US courthouse early Wednesday. Video from the scene appeared to show tear gas and numerous flash grenades. (July 22)
item.author: AP Domestic
item.dc:creator: AP
item.content:encoded: Authorities in Portland, Oregon dispersed a large crowd of demonstrators near the US courthouse early Wednesday. Video from the scene appeared to show tear gas and numerous flash grenades. (July 22)

item.author: USA TODAY
item.dc:creator: Colin Atagi and Chris Woodyard, USA TODAY
item.content:encoded: Authorities are investigating a link between shootings in Crestline, California, and North Brunswick, New Jersey

item.title: Racing for a Remedy: Silent Stalker
item.description: Silent spread of virus keeps scientists grasping for clues. Several studies are underway to see if the virus can be detected before symptoms develop. (July 22)
item.author: AP Domestic
item.dc:creator: AP
item.content:encoded: Silent spread of virus keeps scientists grasping for clues. Several studies are underway to see if the virus can be detected before symptoms develop. (July 22)

item.title: Some New Yorkers leaving NYC for good after COVID
item.description: COVID-19 took a toll on New Yorkers and many are now choosing to leave behind the hustle and bustle for a quieter life outside the city. (July 22)
item.author: AP Domestic
item.dc:creator: AP
item.content:encoded: COVID-19 took a toll on New Yorkers and many are now choosing to leave behind the hustle and bustle for a quieter life outside the city. (July 22)

item.title: Statue removal harder in rural areas
item.description: Since the death of George Floyd, at least 63 Confederate markers and monuments have been removed from public land across the country. But the battle to bring them down in more rural and conservative areas isn't easy. (July 22)
item.author: AP Domestic
item.dc:creator: AP
item.content:encoded: Since the death of George Floyd, at least 63 Confederate markers and monuments have been removed from public land across the country. But the battle to bring them down in more rural and conservative areas isn't easy. (July 22)

item.title: 14 hurt in shooting outside Chicago funeral home
item.description: Fourteen people were injured, one person was being questioned and multiple suspects were being sought after gunfire erupted outside a funeral home on Chicago's South Side, police said Tuesday. (July 22)
item.author: AP Domestic
item.dc:creator: AP
item.content:encoded: Fourteen people were injured, one person was being questioned and multiple suspects were being sought after gunfire erupted outside a funeral home on Chicago's South Side, police said Tuesday. (July 22)

item.title: Today in History for July 22nd
item.description: Highlights of this day in history: Wiley Post completes first solo flight around the world; Robber John Dillinger shot dead; Saddam Hussein's sons killed in Iraq; The September 11th Commission releases its report; Birth of the Frisbee. (July 22)
item.author: AP Domestic
item.dc:creator: AP
item.content:encoded: Highlights of this day in history: Wiley Post completes first solo flight around the world; Robber John Dillinger shot dead; Saddam Hussein's sons killed in Iraq; The September 11th Commission releases its report; Birth of the Frisbee. (July 22)

item.author: USA TODAY
item.dc:creator: Jordan Culver, USA TODAY
item.content:encoded: More than 30 caltrops were recovered in early July by the Smith County Sheriff's Office and the Texas Department of Transportation.

item.title: In CA: 50,400 minutes how do you measure five weeks?
item.description: Officials warn that's how long we could stay on shutdown. Do you count job losses? Number of permanent business closures? Impacts to mental health? Yes. And I talk to an author who writes about that time she took up boxing at age 28 ... and in the process helped K.O. past demons.
item.author: USA TODAY
item.dc:creator: Arlene Martinez, USA TODAY
item.content:encoded: Officials warn that's how long we could stay on shutdown. Do you count job losses? Number of permanent business closures? Impacts to mental health? Yes. And I talk to an author who writes about that time she took up boxing at age 28 ... and in the process helped K.O. past demons.

item.title: A 'very dark history': Oregon's racist past fuels ongoing protests against injustice in Portland
item.description: A history of racism in Oregon provides the context for the ongoing protests in Portland, where federal agents have clashed with demonstrators.
item.author: USA TODAY
item.dc:creator: Jorge L. Ortiz, USA TODAY
item.content:encoded: A history of racism in Oregon provides the context for the ongoing protests in Portland, where federal agents have clashed with demonstrators.

item.title: Shooting suspect Roy Den Hollander was a men's rights activist. What does that mean?
item.description: Roy Den Hollander, the self-proclaimed anti-feminist lawyer, invoked men's rights throughout his life. What is it and how did it emerge?
item.author: USA TODAY
item.dc:creator: Joshua Bote, USA TODAY
item.content:encoded: Roy Den Hollander, the self-proclaimed anti-feminist lawyer, invoked men's rights throughout his life. What is it and how did it emerge?
